metadata.title: CVE-2020-26144 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered on Samsung Galaxy S3 i9305 4.4.4 devices. The WEP,WPA, WPA2, and WPA3 implementations accept plaintext A-MSDU frames as longas the first 8 bytes correspond to a valid RFC1042 (i.e., LLC/SNAP) headerfor EAPOL. An adversary can abuse this to inject arbitrary network packetsindependent of the network configuration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
